We are excited to share the latest SeedToScale podcast on "Future of Banking in India" with Vinay Bagri, co-founder and CEO of Niyo Solutions Inc. Here are some highlights from the conversation and why we are excited about this segment as Accel: 1) Banking opportunity in India is tremendous, with overall banking assets expected to reach $3T by 2025, with deeply under-penetrated private credit markets which account for ~50% of GDP (vs. 150%+ for developed economies). 2) In a survey we ran, we learned that more than 80% of respondents who shifted to digital banking solutions did so for ease of usage. 3) Given India’s demographic dividend, the banking ecosystem will see a huge impact with 300M new accounts being created in the next 5 years. Digitally forward players will capture this net new market growth. 4) As Accel, we believe that technology can revolutionize banking, and fortunate to be partners with Niyo on this journey. In this conversation, Vinay talks about some of his reflections on the ongoing changes in the banking ecosystem 5) Highlights of the podcast: - Large market opportunity in India - 18:05 - A completely new banking experience - 20:22 - Success of Neobanks globally - 24:00 - Customer segmentation - 30:25 - State of regulations in India - 36:28 Full Blog with market details here at SeedToScale -> https://bit.ly/STS_Niyo Podcast video here: https://lnkd.in/d8WmMYMd Super excited to chat with Ashwin Damera, CEO & Co-Founder Emeritus at Wharton's "How to Build Your First $1 Billion Unicorn" Live Fireside Chat, on 15th March, 2022. Founding Member and Legal Advisor, Excelerate at Excelerate. I am an advisor, lawyer, angel investor, and mentor to early-stage startup founders in silicon valley and across the world. I advise early-stage start-up companies from 2-3 "guys in the garage" to global multinational corporations from inception through the life-cycle of the venture, negotiating angel and venture financings, customer and licensing transactions, and mergers and acquisitions. Over the last 19 years working at powerhouse law firms like Cooley Godward and Orrick Herrington, and now Inventus Law, I have represented over 3,000 startups, angels, and founders, and have been involved in almost 500 financing and M&A transactions valued at over $3 billion in the aggregate. I have made over 25 angel investments in companies across the spectrum, from healthcare, financial services, to software and saas ventures. I am licensed to practice law in California, New York and India, and have represented U.S based investors and Companies in investments, acquisitions, and strategic expansion with India based companies, as well as 100's of startups from India, Singapore, Europe and South America in setting up operations and closing financing and M& A transactions in Silicon Valley. I also have an active practice representing global companies that are part of YC, 500 Startups, Startup Chile, Tandem, Alchemist, Fabric and other accelerators and incubators. Inventus Law is my own entrepreneurial venture with the primary goal of providing experienced legal counsel to start-up companies in a much more cost-effective, responsive and founder friendly manner than any of the "big"? law firms out there. Lawyers at Inventus Law love helping founders of startup companies navigate the many pitfalls a startup usually encounters, and have worked with companies in a wide spectrum of industries, and going through varied lifecycles, from self-funded, seed funded to fast-growing $100M+ Companies. Inventus Law (www.inventuslaw.com) is a corporate law firm focusing on representing founders, startups, angel investors, venture investors, and corporations on technology, venture financings, licensing, mergers and acquisitions and joint venture transactions primarily in Silicon Valley, but increasingly in and from India, Israel, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. We represent founders of high growth startup companies, including many Companies from YC (Y Combinator), 500 Startups, Tandem Capital, The Fabric, Morpheus, Kae Capital, Mumbai Angels, TiE Angels, Lionsbird, Alchemist, K-12, and other leading incubators across the major tech centers of the world.

In 2008, I joined Foundation Capital as a General Partner because I thought it would be a great opportunity to apply my lifelong learning of scaling organizations to help entrepreneurs succeed in achieving their vision. I get most excited about B2B/enterprise software. Like many of the partners at Foundation Capital, my background is as an operator. I’ve spent 15 years in a variety of roles that have taught me some important lessons . I’ve applied these lessons to being the type of board member who truly acts as a partner to the entrepreneurs by being a friend and supporter, but also a challenger, and through that, hopefully helping the founder to achieve their highest aspirations. I feel very privileged to be an early investor in Databricks (valued at $38B) and 6 other unicorns (Cohesity, Eightfold, Amperity, Turing, Anyscale and Alation). One of my high points as a VC was when one of my CEOs told me that he enjoys putting me in front of his entire team [in all hands meetings] because he felt it has a positive impact on internal motivation and in turn, the bottom line. I was so grateful to receive this kind of feedback because helping my portfolio companies succeed is my main goal as a VC. One way I realize this is through my unconditional commitment to stand by a founder’s side as we work together to make their company a success throughout all of the highs and lows a startup naturally experiences. One thing that I’ve learned through my operational experience is being able to really zoom in and focus on important issues that will improve a product or the overall user experience. I’m not really a fade-into-the-background kind of guy. What I mean by that is I am committed to delivering constructive feedback in a respectful way if I feel it will propel growth forward, even if it can get uncomfortable at times. However, I also believe I am good at knowing when to step aside and let the entrepreneur execute. Follow me @ashugarg

Co-founder of Expertscape, global directory of medical experts. Founder of Kiinetics. B2B sales coach/training workshops/consultant. Author. Speaker. Podcaster. Expertscape identifies and objectively ranks medical expertise in over 30,000 specific topics. When someone is diagnosed with a serious condition, it is incredibly challenging to find a truly knowledgeable physician for a second opinion or more specialized treatment. And healthcare institutions have highly-ranked expertise that they don't know about, so can't brag about them. Expertscape identifies and objectively ranks medical expertise by specific topic. Used by patients and referring physicians for a consult or second opinion, Expertscape also enables health systems and hospitals to profile and promote their world-class staff. Expertscape.com uses a multi-dimensional expert-rank algorithm to quantify biomedical expertise, combined with a simple, intuitive web-based application to provide a coherent, objective way to find the best institutions and individual experts when and where they are needed. General Partner, A91 Partners. The reallocation of priorities among startups is welcome and long overdue. What we also need is a (private) acceptance of responsibility by companies and investors - if capital was being misallocated, it didn’t misallocate itself. Decisions were made that led to the misallocation. Owning up to mistakes is step 1 of being able to correct them and build a foundation for an enduring business. Amazing to see how much the company has achieved even since we first met you. Vinayak S. Saket Dandotia Alok Patil - Kaushik Anand, I and all of A91 Partners are glad to be your partners and embarking on the next leg of this journey with you. We look forward to building a great company together! Today we are pleased to announce the closing of $550M A91 Fund II. We are incredibly grateful to both our investors and the founders that have partnered with us and continue to inspire and educate us every day. We started A91 in 2018 with the following beliefs - the nature of entrepreneurship in India is changing, more new age businesses will be created, and patient capital will play an important role in accelerating value creation. We also believed in the opportunity to create a world-class Indian investment firm - for founders who are aiming to build large enduring businesses from India, for either local or global markets. All these beliefs have been strengthened over the last 3 years. While it is early in our journey at A91, we aspire to be enduring ourselves, and be long-term partners to founders. We are delighted to take one more step along our journey to partner with the next generation of founders building enduring businesses. Mr Senapathy “Kris” Gopalakrishnan is the Chairman of Axilor Ventures, an accelerator that helps start-ups during the early stage of their business journey. Kris served as the vice chairman of Infosys from 2011 to 2014 and the chief executive officer and managing director of Infosys from 2007 to 2011. Kris is one of the co-founders of Infosys. Recognized as a global business and technology thought leader, he was voted the top CEO (IT Services category) in Institutional Investor's inaugural ranking of Asia's Top Executives and selected as one of the winners of the second Asian Corporate Director Recognition Awards by Corporate Governance Asia in 2011. He also was selected to Thinkers 50, an elite list of global business thinkers, in 2009. He was elected president of India's apex industry chamber Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) for 2013-14, and served as one of the co-chairs of the World Economic Forum in Davos in January 2014. In January 2011, the Government of India awarded Mr. Gopalakrishnan the Padma Bhushan, the country’s third-highest civilian honor. Mr Gopalakrishnan serves on the Board of Governors of Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (OIST) and is the Chairman, Board of Governors of IIIT, Bangalore. He is the Chairman of the Vision Group on Information Technology of Karnataka Government and the Chairman of CII Digital Council. Mr Gopalakrishnan is the chairman of Itihaasa Research and Digital which publishes history of Indian IT industry as “itihaasa” (http://www.itihaasa.com/) app as well as reports on industrial and academic research in India. Mr Gopalakrishnan invests in promoting research on Brain sciences, aging related disorders as well as investing in start-ups and start-up ecosystem. Mr. Gopalakrishnan holds Master’s degrees in physics and computer science from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras. Kris is a Fellow of Indian National Academy of Engineers (INAE) and an Honorary Fellow of Institution of Electronics and Telecommunication Engineers (IETE) of India.

Poor nations would consistently remain poor unless they value time and productivity becomes a strong desire/value. Those who desire instant wealth are easy to manipulate. Those who desire instant fame are easiest to manipulate. Extra cautious spenders are like a dam that keep accumulating and end up splurging on emotional life events. Trying to make pennies from them is thus hard and better to be building business around their dam breaks. Starting your own business unleashes a super trait that’s otherwise rarely found: ability to mind your own business. Maturity is outcome of setbacks and heartbreaks. It comes faster to those who went all in on things that didn’t work out. Those who remain shallow in their pursuits rarely get broken and thus are never rebuilt. Leadership is building people to build. Many mistaken it as using people to build. Hiring better than you is only possible if you know yourself well. More often than not, only those who take consistent actions towards their financial wellness create wealth that drastically boosts their net worth. At CRED, we ensure actions towards financial wellness become the default mode for our members. In the month of November: 8.2 lakh CRED members avoided extra interest charges by acting on alerts and paying their bills in full. 90 Cr worth of late payments fees was avoided with the help of timely reminders from CRED. 40.24% of our members improved their credit scores by incorporating the suggested actions from the app. 200 Cr worth of hidden charges were detected by members using CRED Protect. 36 Cr worth of cashback was won by members for taking the right financial decisions.

Manish Singhal is a technologist turned entrepreneur turned venture capitalist. He aspires to help put India on the deep tech innovation map of the world via his work at pi Ventures. He brings 28+ years of experience across diverse sets of fields - building cutting edge deep technology products at global scale, mentoring startups, investing in them and building a deep tech venture fund. Manish started pi Ventures in early 2016 with the vision of accelerating the development of Artificial Intelligence startups in India. In 2015, he noticed a trend of some companies using patterns in data to bring insights and deliver significantly differentiated outcomes for their customers. Such startups could potentially outshine their peers to become category leaders. The journey of pi Ventures started with this thesis. Now apart from looking at Digital disruptions, he is also passionate about supporting disruptions in the Beyond Digital space like space tech, material science, bio tech etc He has been actively involved in the startup eco-system in India for the last few years. He co-founded LetsVenture.com and led it to become the leading marketplace for startups & early stage investors in India within a very short span of time. Before LetsVenture, he was the India country manager for Sling Media Inc, a silicon valley based consumer electronic startup. He built the R&D and product team in India from scratch and took it to a successful acquisition. He is also a founder-mentor for an initiative called Women Entrepreneur Quest, which is an annual event for recognizing and rewarding women entrepreneurs in India. This initiative was founded in 2010 and will be hosting its fifth later this year. After doing his engineering from IIT Kanpur in 1992, he has been instrumental in building several products and teams in different startups and established organisations like Sling Media, Ittiam Systems and Motorola. He has contributed to the standardisation of MPEG-4 standard as well and holds couple of video technology patents to his name. He has experience in building hardware standalone products as well as cloud enabled software products. He is a keen sports enthusiast and a published wild life photographer.

The Sales Enablement Society (SES) is a volunteer organization focused on elevating the role of Sales Enablement in organizations worldwide through engagement, communication, research, and development. We are the first non-profit Sales Enablement community of Malaysia. Founded in 2016 in the United States, with five founding members, the SES has grown to more than 2,500 members in 13 countries with chapters across the globe. Members represent all areas of the sales enablement community – practitioners, suppliers, industry experts, and academics. The Sales Enablement Society is a volunteer organization founded in January 2016, by a diverse group of like-minded sales and marketing professionals based in the Washington, D.C. area. The SES's overall mission identifies best practices for successful outcomes, clarifies the operations for the sales enablement business, and develops the criteria for sales enablement roles within successful organizations.

Raj Chinai is a Managing Director at LCR Capital Partners, a U.S.-based private investment and advisory services firm, which is focused on helping families globally secure access to alternative investment opportunities in the US and Europe. Chairperson and Senior Managing Director of Accenture in India Rekha M. Menon is the Chairperson and Senior Managing Director at Accenture in India. She is also a member of the National Council of CII, USIBC’s India Advisory Council, the Chair of the Governing Council of National Skill Development Corporation’s (NSDC) Sector Skills Council and is on the Boards of NASSCOM Foundation, Data Security Council of India (DSCI) and Invest India. She lives in Bangalore, India.

Rishad is Chairman of global technology services company, Wipro Limited.Until recently, he was the Chief Strategy Officer, responsible for shaping Wipro's strategy and growth. He is also on the Board of Azim Premji Foundation - one of the largest not-for-profit initiatives in India - that works with over 350,000 government schools across seven states in India to improve the state of primary education. Separately, he is also on the Board of Azim Premji Philanthropic Initiatives. Rishad was the Chairman of NASSCOM, the trade body of India’s $170 billion software industry, in 2018-2019. In 2014, he was recognised as a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum, for his leadership, professional accomplishments, and commitment to society.

His operational expertise is product management, business development, sales acceleration, recruiting, follow-on fundraising, and scaling. Everyday banking for small business, globally I am a technologist at heart and an entrepreneur by spirit. A big part of my career over 30 years has been focused on building and scaling financial products. I co-founded Truly Financial in 2021 and Remitr in 2016. Previously, I built the first multi-currency accounting software at FACT Software and was a founding team member at HR & Payroll SaaS provider, Emportant Technologies, which I helped scale as a global platform. I also built one of India’s first community portals, which went on to become one of the largest online communities at that time. Specialties: Scaling a small business, Global commerce, B2B marketing, Inbound, Online Services and International Payments. Truly Financial is the first real alternative to global banking built exclusively for small businesses who buy, sell or hire anywhere in the world. It combines an FDIC-insured USD checking account and a multi-currency account with physical and virtual expense cards. Business owners can streamline payments and expenses, while empowering their teams via linked cards featuring customized spending controls. Designed to help small businesses grow, the platform focuses on giving small businesses global reach with faster payments, lower fees, and more perks. C100 and its members support the global community of Canada-connnected founders through mentorship, investment, partnership, and talent. Member-supported, not-for-profit member association, headquartered in San Francisco, California, with members across the major technology hubs of the US, Canada, and beyond. Remitr is a business payments provider in the fintech space, offering businesses a better alternative to wire transfers, cheques and bank visits. The established Remitr Global Network allows businesses to make fast—often one day—payments across Canada and in over 150 countries. Remitr also offers the Global Business Account for USD, GBP and EUR, removing the exorbitant banking fees of receiving international payments. Remitr now processes hundreds of millions of dollars annually and is backed by a marquee of global investors.

Sanjay is a Co Founder & Managing Partner of Blume Ventures, one of India's leading early stage VC firms. Blume has emerged as one of India's leading early-stage funds, having invested in over 50 startups since its inception in late 2010. Blume's portfolio includes Taxiforsure acquired by Olacabs), Zipdial acquired by Twitter), Qubecell acquired by Boku), Grey Orange Pte Lte, Mettl, Webengage, Hotelogix, Exotel, Rolocule Games, and Carbon Clean Solutions, amongst others. Many of Blume’s portfolio companies have secured follow-on financing from top tier global VCs including Tiger Global, Accel, Matrix, Bessemer, Cisco Ventures, to name a few. Blume’s Platform model and vibrant network leans heavily on Sanjay's ability to think laterally, connect the dots, and reach across the global ecosystem-at-large. Prior to Blume, Sanjay was also an active angel investor through Mumbai Angels. His angel investments include Inmobi formerly Mkhoj), Appsdaily formerly Onward Mobility), Little Eye Labs acquired by Facebook), Tonbo Imaging, Atyourprice and Svasti Microfinance amongst others.Sanjay’s experience spans the US and India, and ranges from management consulting PwC and IBM Global Services), product marketing and operations Sun Microsystems) and angel investing thru Mumbai Angels). Most recently, prior to founding Blume, he co founded Loxodrome, a legal outsourcing company with dual-shore operations in San Francisco and Pune, India. Early in his career, Sanjay supported the growth of Kanbay Nasdaq IPO in ’04), then acquired by Cap Gemini for $1.25BL in ‘06.He brings a strong global network across the US, South East Asia and India. Sanjay is passionate about mentoring entrepreneurs and is active in associations including TiE and BITS Spark Angels. Sanjay has earned an MBA from UCLA’s Anderson Graduate School of Management and also holds an undergraduate major in Information Systems from BITS, Pilani.

Sean Jacobsohn is a partner at Norwest Venture Partners and former enterprise cloud executive with broad technology, sales and business development expertise. He focuses on early to late stage investment opportunities in enterprise cloud, including mobile-first business applications, human assisted AI, B2B marketplaces, and industry cloud solutions. He currently serves on the board of Elevate, Enable, FloQast, Legion, Propel, and Spiff, led the investment in Workato, is a board observer for Demandbase and Prodly, and previously served on the boards of Engagio (acquired by Demandbase), Rallyteam (acquired by Workday) and Satmetrix (acquired by NICE). Sean was previously a venture partner at Emergence Capital Partners where he focused on enterprise cloud investments, after being an executive and advisor at Emergence Capital portfolio companies Hightail and Doximity, respectively. Previously he was VP of Channel Management at Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ: CSOD), a human capital management software-as-a-service provider. Sean helped grow the company from $7 million to $75 million in revenue and 300,000 subscribers to over 7.5 million. Before his tenure at Cornerstone OnDemand, Sean was VP Sales and Partner Development at WageWorks (NYSE: WAGE), a leading provider of consumer-directed spending solutions, which grew from $3 million to $82 million in revenue during his tenure. Prior to WageWorks, he was at Upwork (NYSE: UPWK), the world’s largest marketplace of contractors. Sean holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BBA in Marketing, Finance, and International Business from University of Wisconsin. He's co-founder of the HBS Alumni Angels, the largest university-affiliated angel group in the world.

Sequoia India Abheek Anand Pieter Kemps Rohit Agarwal Johan Surani Gian Adhitya Shenya Wang Aakash Kapoor Anandamoy Roychowdhary In end-September 2014, I got extremely lucky to run into William Tanuwijaya on my first trip to Jakarta ever. Total serendipity. I recall being very inspired by William's authenticity and a deep commitment to serve merchants. Later that week we agreed on terms to invest in Tokopedia. It was Sequoia India's first investment in Indonesia. A few weeks later, on a subsequent trip to Jakarta, I got introduced to Nadiem Makarim. We had a spirited debate about launching GoFood in the first meeting itself, the app wasnt event launched then. A few weeks later in March 2015, we signed a termsheet to invest in Gojek. The founding team's mission orientation, passion, boldness and focus on user experience were all things we loved. Six years later, all of us at Sequoia India are incredibly grateful, humbled and filled with appreciation for what the teams at Gojek and Tokopedia have achieved. Its not a stretch to say our belief in the SEA market was shaped by our experiences working alongside Andre Soelistyo Kevin Aluwi William Tanuwijaya Patrick Cao Nadiem Makarim and others. We are also very excited about the future of GoTo and the impact it will have in shaping the future of Indonesia.

Now with an amazing product and a great market fit, the team is flying and scaling their business profitably. https://lnkd.in/gRs-fF9Q #founders #business #thegritstories ??????????: What ?????????? do founders use during early days as well as when their startup's scale? Some of my thoughts. Let me know what you think? Here are some of the words founders have used with me and how it changes over time. 1. ?????? ???? ???? ???? ??????????: Early-days lots of YES decisions as they are in the mode of experimentation and every idea looks interesting. Occasional NO decisions. As the company scales, you will start hearing a lot of NOs as they want the org to be focused and keep the company on things that work and matter. Almost no MAYBE words used when they are operating at scale. Successful founders become very decisive. 2. ??????, ????????????????, ???????? ????????, ???????? ??????????, ???????? ??????????????: During early days, especially before PMF, things have to be done in hours (NOW), not even TOMORROW. A lot of things move fast and things break, and things get done in almost real-time to discover the market, product engagement, G2M, positioning, website, advertisements, conversations with potential customers, etc. In fact, the reason startups win is this velocity in finding deep insights into the market. Even things like pushing code to production happen daily and weekly, rarely over months. As the companies scale, founders don't get involved in daily or weekly decisions. They start participating in discussions that have an impact over months and quarters. At scale, if they continue to use NOW or TOMORROW, most likely the company growth will come down OR they don't have a strong layer-1 team. 3. ????????????, ?????????? ??????, ?????? ???? ??????????????????: During early days, so much is happening, there is not even time to enjoy, so lots of THANKS and equivalent acks happen in the startup. Slowly, founders realize the importance of recognizing the contributors (GREAT JOB DONE) in front of other members. As they scale, the further realization is that a lot of team members contribute to any material success and that leads to celebrating the success (LET US CELEBRATE) and less individual performances. 4. ?????????? ????????, ???????? ????????????, ???????????????? ???????? Before PMF, all ideas are half-baked, half-written, with a not-so-great copy. Basically, all things are in DRAFT-MODE, as there is not enough time or data to spend any extra time in experimentation. As the idea starts showing up some results, founders start pushing for GOOD ENOUGH work, as long as the data is showing that the project is moving in the right direction. When startups get more customers, brand, product, team members, founders realize that they cannot push any more DRAFT-MODE work. Credibility matters. They want to see DETAILED PLANs of the projects, all the way from G2M to execution including time and budgets. Yes, it slows down, but, that is where focus comes, and founders start thinking in terms of QUARTERS. Impact words, such as GROWTH, LEADER start being heard as companies mature. Well, this is for some other day. Amazing to see the growth of @chargebee. Do you want to know how? Please read below. We started our journey with Krish Subramanian, Rajaraman Santhanam from the very early days. Hearty congratulations on this raise of $250M at $3.5B. I must narrate one of the untold stories of Chargebee. I use to go to Chennai to meet Girish Mathrubootham at Freshworks after our investment in 2011. On each trip, I would meet Chargebee founders for breakfast (8:30 to 10) and then, a whole day at Freshworks office. This habit continued even after seed investment into Chargebee. One day, Krish and Rajaraman got tired of this arrangement and told me that ".... One day we will make sure you travel to Chennai only to meet us and you do breakfast slot for some other startup...". Well, that started happening as early as 2014, as the company did an amazing job in scaling their revenues, team, global ambitions and more to discuss in each trip. Hats off to Chargebee team in scaling the company in an extraordinary fashion in the last several years. How? They did amazing things with a maniacal focus. Here are some:1. Customer obsession in terms of service, support, and making sure they are served better. Easier said than done. 2. Superfast product iteration in listening to customers, translating customer requests to product features, and taking product features to production. What I call Concept -> Production in weeks instead of quarters. 3. Every successful company has an amazing employee culture and commitment. Even today, when I talk to the leadership team, I learn something new about how they are thinking about making employees empowered, learning, and contributing. Amazing place for employees. 4. Crazy about supporting and selling to all sizes of customers, just-minted startups to extra-ordinarily large companies. With a great G2M team, the company has built a powerful engine of sales. 5. And, always learning leadership. I am still looking for a call, where, I can say I have read a new book ahead of Krish. The leadership is fearless in saying "I don't know" when they don't know, but with strong confidence, they always say "we will find the best way to do this...", by learning from others. And many others, but, I must say this is just the beginning of Chargebee's next chapter of scale. Congratulations and welcome to Sequoia India and Tejeshwi Sharma in co-leading this round. Looking forward to their contribution and partnership in making this a massive company, from India to the world! Remote Knowledge Work Any tactical things you do to make teams out of individuals? Team meetings on video are hard. No-agenda catch-ups are gone. Impromptu group chats are not happening. New employees are missing a sense of belonging. Love to hear your playbook for remote work. All the engineers out there: I have a question for you. Do you search code in your code repository? When do you search? If you have written the code, and you find a bug, you know where to go. But, in most cases, you inherit someone else's code and when you see issues to fix or refactor code OR API enhancement, do you search code? What tools do you use? I am trying to assess whether a world-class code search tool (aka Google for code search) helps and accelerates developer time? Yes, there are several open source projects, including OpenGraph, Hound, CodePilot and several others. I am assessing whether this is a "nice-to-have" tool or "must-have" and would developers pay if this saves time. Here is one google paper that talks a bit about it: https://lnkd.in/gFVk5d_m Amazing progress with Appsmith, one of our seed investment that happened with Abhishek Nayak Nikhil Nandagopal and Arpit Mohan. Building internal apps for productivity and operational excellence has been a pain point from the days of my own coding. Always neglected with most of the engineers being hijacked to customer-facing features. With Appsmith those days are over. - Power to engineers to build internal apps super fast with all the controls necessary. - High-quality/finish UI so that internal users love your work. - Built ground-up as an open-source project with more than 120+ contributors across the globe. Plus, they have more than 7000+ stars on their repository. Very active and fast-growing community. The best part is that all the founders have deep understanding of the needs of internal apps and you will see a great set of integrations to all types of data sources so that one can build apps in hours and days. Congratulations with this Series A and with this raise we should see an acceleration of the platform as well. #coding #locode #opensource Girish Mathrubootham this has been the most humbling experience for me as well. You have been an amazing person, grounded, good in listening and at the same time push back when necessary. This has been a once-in-a-lifetime learning experience for me as well, as Freshworks grew, I have grown along with the company. Thanks for the opportunity to partner with you from the very early days to where we are today. I have cherished every moment of our engagement. I am looking forward to our engagement over the next decade of FRSH. What an amazing day of celebrating the listing of FRSH on NASDAQ./ Amazing day for all of us who work in the startup eco-system. Amazing day for founders across the globe, especially India to think big, dream big, and a possibility of making it happen! Our journey is over 10+ years, when Freshworks was at 6 employees. Girish Mathrubootham and Shan Krishnasamy had a simple formula to win at a global level 1. Pick a large market and continue to expand the market (today - $120B) 2. Build a pixel-perfect world-class product. Delighting the customers in every touch point. 3. Strive 2x the value at 1/2 the cost in every possible way. 4. Focus on hiring the best of the talent. Help them focus on customers. The rest will happen. 5. And help others in the eco-system on the way so that pay-forward is constantly happening in the eco-system. Thanks to this amazing journey for all of us at Accel with Freshworks. #startup #founders

Cheers Sid SAP October 2014–Present (9 months) New Delhi, India Vice President Strategic Industries- I took over as VP of Strategic Industries for SAP in India in October. A new Sales Sub vertical called “Key -PSU’s within Strategic Industries was created which represented the largest License installed base of SAP India in core Industries. As a leader of this Vertical, I was asked to evangelize SAP’s innovations for these industries, recruit, train and retain a team of five Senior Account Directors for: - Rebuilding SAP’s position as a trusted advisor to the Boards of these Companies. - Introducing SAP’s innovations to the customers, partners and the influencers. - Created capabilities with in SAP and with the external stakeholders to address the needs of these customers better. - Built high growth and sustainable business for SAP in this sector. Over the course of my tenure, SAP has regained its presence in this Strategic Sub-Vertical, we achieved a performance which is more than double of SAP’s average performance from this sector in the last 5 years. I have also created a team (Account Directors and Virtual Account Team) which is passionate about making a difference every single day. This stint gave me the privilege to work with one of the most admirable Business leaders of India. Sindhu Gangadharan is among the leading voices in the world of Technology today. Sindhu is widely regarded as the Technology Humanist – a title she earned for her deep-rooted belief in Technology and for leveraging Tech solutions for the benefit of the society at large. During her 22 years at SAP, Sindhu rose through the ranks and navigated several strategic and leadership roles to become the first woman to lead SAP Labs India – the place where she started off her career as a young software developer. As the Managing Director of SAP Labs in India, Sindhu is responsible for product development and innovation at SAP's Research & Development facilities in India. In her additional responsibility as Senior Vice President, Sindhu leads the SAP User Enablement unit which provides a consistent, intelligent, and personalised enablement for SAP's entire product portfolio. Sindhu is known for her deep technical expertise and is widely respected for bringing to life SAP's vision of the Intelligent Enterprise during her time at the SAP headquarters in Germany. In 2021, Sindhu was recognized by Fortune Magazine among Top 50 Most Powerful Women in Business for her critical contribution in saving lives during the COVID19 pandemic. Sindhu is known for her inclusive leadership style and is widely admired as a People Leader and a long-standing Ally of the LGBTQIA+ community. Most Influential AI Leader and Inspiring Business Leader are a few other titles she received for her contribution towards creating a more diverse and inclusive IT industry in India. As a global technology leader, Sindhu serves on the Board of multiple organisations like Utah-based Qualtrics, Titan Company and EverLoop. In her role as the Executive Council Member at NASSCOM, India’s apex technology and industry trade body, Sindhu plays a key role in charting the next chapter of India’s USD 1Trillion Digital Economy, while also developing India as a Technology Hub for the World. Sindhu’s incredible journey as a tech visionary and her continued support in empowering and enabling the youth of India has earned her a position on the Advisory Board of YuWaah, supported by the UNICEF. She is also a Member of the Steering Committee of the Indo-German Chamber of Commerce, and a key influencer driving the bilateral trade and deliberations between India and Germany. Sindhu is based out of Bangalore where she lives with her husband, two daughters and Dexter.

If you are given a chance to be a role model, I think you should always take it because you can influence a person’s life in a positive light, and that’s what I want to do. That’s what it’s all about. Your minds influence the key activity of the brain, which then influences everything; perception, cognition, thoughts and feelings, personal relationships; they’re all a projection of you. If you were born with the ability to change someone’s perspective or emotions, never waste that gift. It is one of the most powerful gifts God can give – the ability to influence. Nobody should be whipped. Remember that, once and for all. Neither man nor animal can be influenced by anything but suggestion. Don’t be a pepper on the eyes of people; Rather be the salt on their tongue and make a difference that influences their sense of belonging to the earth. The real beginning of influence comes as others sense you are being influenced by them ? when they feel understood by you ? that you have listened deeply and sincerely, and that you are open. You don’t have to be a person of influence to be influential. In fact, the most influential people in my life are probably not even aware of the things they’ve taught me. No matter how much you love the person, you cannot change them. You may influence them; but at the end of the day, they must decide for themselves. Some of the most important decisions I have made might well have never been made or might have been very different if it hadn’t been for the influence of the people in my life. We all need mentors.

B2B selling was long impending an overhaul, and 2020 only acted as a catalyst. It's no surprise that remote sales exploded in 2020.While most B2B companies and sales teams adapted rather quickly, it came at a price. - Modern B2B sales tech stacks took care of everything but account research, and it stuck out like a sore thumb. - SDRs *had* to ensure their pitches were personalized, relevant, well-timed, and contextual. It meant more time and effort for account research vs. making the calls. - A usual target account research that took 20-25 mins now took hours together. - Google and LinkedIn Sales Navigator didn't make the research easier. And why would they? SDRs weren't their target audience, and account research wasn't their problem. So, SDRs had to sweep through an overload of information to find something remotely relevant.The struggle was evident, but there was no solution out there. And that's why we started B2Brain. SDRs wanted answers to two specific questions: - How do I get insights from the target account relevant to my business? - Who are the people I should pursue in the target accounts? B2Brain set out to help SDRs get account intelligence unique to their business directly inside their existing CRMs and SEPs. Try it out for yourself. Take a free trial today - https://app.b2brain.com/trial/ Before B2Brain, I spent ~15 years building and launching products. - I was the first VP of Product and Corporate Development at InMobi, India's first Unicorn - I launched and managed 3 products at Yahoo! India (Maps, Local, and Jobs) - I built multiple products at Zoho, the flag-bearer of India's SaaS ecosystem. With B2Brain, get B2B account intelligence on autopilot for SDRs, AEs, and sales teams. - Get contextual and personalized intel with one click, delivered straight to your CRM. - Get bite-sized talking points along with your intel. We bet your talk track has never looked better. - Target the right people automatically with relevant leads. - Share intel with the rest of the sales and success team. Provide a seamless and consistent experience to your prospect. - Get all of this without any manual research. Take B2Brain for a spin today - https://app.b2brain.com/trial/

I have been selling “professionally” for about 18 years, and overall for over three decades. When someone says s/he hasn't sold anything, anytime, that’s not true. We all sell something every day. When you go for interviews, you are selling your capabilities. When you go on a date, you are selling your charm. When you meet your boss, you are trying to sell something else. So in our daily lives we always sell something. People buy from people they like - You will not buy a car from a salesperson if you don’t like the salesperson; well you may in extreme cases. I hope you get the point. In this case the car salesperson tries to understand your requirements. S/he tries to understand you and your family and then proposes the salient features of the car. Out of curiosity, they said: "We must inspect and know it by touch, of which we are capable". So, they sought it out, and when they found it they groped about it. In the case of the first person, whose hand landed on the trunk, said "This being is like a thick snake". For another one whose hand reached its ear, it seemed like a kind of fan. As for another person, whose hand was upon its leg, said, the elephant is a pillar like a tree-trunk. The blind man who placed his hand upon its side said, "elephant is a wall". Another who felt its tail, described it as a rope. The last felt its tusk, stating the elephant is that which is hard, smooth and like a spear. - Wikipedia In the same way, most of us look at small pieces of information and try to deduce the outcome without looking at the complete picture. Does empowering customers with more information really help them make better decisions? Most commonly believed thought by us is that satisfying customers’ every request for information and support makes buying easier. This may sound counterintuitive but believe me piling on more information and options just makes things harder for customers while making decisions. In fact, one of the researches done by CEB & as included in the book “The New Sales Imperative” depicts that one of the perils of responsiveness & information deluge is decrease in the likeliness of purchase ease and increase in the likeliness of purchase regret. On the contrary, a proactive, prescriptive approach that guides customers through decision making increases the likelihood of purchase ease. Prescription may take many forms, but the companies that have mastered it employ the same practices: They work to deeply understand the customer’s purchase journey; identify the most significant customer challenge at each buying stage; arm their salespeople with tools to help overcome each challenge; and trace the customer’s progress so that they can intervene at any moment to keep the process on track. #thoughtfulthursday Is the charm of solution selling fading away & metamorphosing into a different form of B2B selling. Under the conventional solution-selling method that has prevailed since Adam was a boy, salespeople are trained to align a solution with an acknowledged customer need. This approach worked earlier because customers didn’t know how to solve their own problems, even though they often had a good understanding of what their problems were. But now, owing to increasing availability of information armed with troves of data, companies can readily define solutions for themselves. In fact, today customers are coming to the table armed to the teeth with a deep understanding of their problem and a well-scoped proposal for a solution. It’s turning many of the sales conversations into fulfillment conversations. Hence, traditional solution selling is replaced with insight selling that rests on the belief that salespeople must lead with disruptive ideas that will make customers aware of unknown needs. Adaptive sales reps, who seek out customers that are primed for change, challenge them with provocative insights, and coach them on how to buy, will become indispensable. They may still be selling solutions—but more broadly, they’re selling insights. #thoughtfulthursday I know, Mr. Srikant is actively looking out for a job in the private sector. A shoutout to my LinkedIn connects to explore opportunities that peak his interest. This is another initiative under #OYOCare for which we have partnered with Give India in order to raise funds to give accommodation support + 3 meals a day to those who need it. #ShelterForAll #IndiaFightsCorona #GiveIndia #OYOforEveryone OYO Here's next in the Thursday Myth buster series - #Myth3: Good Managers Can Manage Anything This myth may be a bit surprising. You’ve likely known or read about someone who seems to have the golden touch when it comes to management. No matter what they do, their teams seem to excel. The reason for such success is often misunderstood. Usually, it’s attributed to the manager’s ability to organize people, institute processes, and adapt as new information becomes available. There’s little doubt that these skills matter. But the other, less discussed aspect of a successful manager’s behavior is this: They hire and nurture the right people so that they perform to the best of their abilities. No amount of guiding, organizing, or process improvement is going to make a team with the wrong people in the wrong roles perform well. Good managers know this and do the hard work of getting the people part right. Extending the Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme (ECLGS) further and widening its scope to cover hospitality, tourism, and related sectors will definitely help MSMEs as 70 per cent enterprises in this sector are small businesses. Although magnitude of the direct impact of this scheme in the travel & tourism sector is dubitable since hospitality, travel & tourism, leisure & sporting sectors would also now be vying along with 27 sectors added under ECLGS 2.0 scope in November 2020 to the original scheme. It atleast makes for a good deal for people to repay loans after two years as part of the scheme. https://lnkd.in/dhBksBr In continuation with the last post in the management myths buster series, here’s the next myth that I believe needs to be busted. #Myth2 Management & Leadership are two peas in a pod You must know which role you play the best & the strengths you bring to it. It’s possible to be a great manager & not a great leader or vice versa. Many of us might have experienced working with a manager with little leadership ability. Whenever the ways of working need to change due to internal or external changes, the manager who lacks leadership ability often struggles to “rally the troops” to a new normal. Similarly, a great leader who has little managerial skills can pull a team in several directions with clarity of vision and positive buzz. Hence it’s critical for a company that great managers either learn leadership skills or align themselves with good leaders. Thoughts?

One of the sharks on the reality-show Shark Tank India, she is committed to creating products that allow every Indian woman to find a favourite and inspire them to start their own entrepreneurship journey. An alumnus of IIT Madras and IIM Ahmedabad, she is famously known for declining a ?1cr job offer from a leading investment bank to follow her heart and dive into entrepreneurship. Also a triathlete and ultramarathoner, her passion for running has helped her challenge her limits time and again. She has been featured in Fortune 40 Under 40 List 2021, The Economic Times, Entrepreneur magazine, Times Of India, YourStory, HT Mint, and much more.

Proven history of increasing customer retention and profitability while reducing costs and overheads. Previous experience in overseeing new hotel openings, designing marketing collateral and directing sales efforts. Outstanding leadership, presentation and communication skills.

Whatfix Accelerates Cloud Adoption by providing a Software Platform that allows enterprises to create Interactive Walkthroughs or Flows that sit as an overlay inside any web application. Each Flow is contextual and will appear based on where you are in the app (location) and who you are (role). Our conviction is that optimal performance and adoption of any web application is attained when there is easy access to contextual Information inside the application at the time a task is being performed. With our Flows, end users learn by doing rather than by reading about it. Whatfix was started in 2013 by two highly experienced telecom professionals and it was recently rated as one of the best startups in Asia. Whatfix enhances the self-service capability of web products and helps companies reduce support queries and improve user engagement. It is a cloud platform that allows product teams to self-curate interactive guides & integrate them across all user touch points. Whatfix is based on patent pending technology and is used by large and small enterprises to: improve training, enhance customer support, and user on-boarding among other use cases. As India's fastest growing health care platform, Lybrate for the first time ever, has enabled people to Ask Health Questions directly to a pool of trusted doctors on its network, without any charge. It is as simple as asking your friend over Whatsapp! People also use Lybrate to find good doctors and Book Appointments. Users also receive health tips straight from doctors in the form of Health Bytes. Not just for health-seekers, it is equally liberating for Doctors, with unique practice enhancing features and practice supporting tools. Lybrate is holistic health care. Browntape is an online SaaS-based software that helps online merchants (sellers on eBay, Amazon, Flipkart, Snapdeal etc) manage their orders and inventory on a single platform. A seller can bulk print shipping labels, invoices and manifests and track the status of all his orders in one console. When an item sells on one marketplace, the stock quantity gets updated on all his online stores automatically via Browntape. One of the top 50 Pharma companies of India, La Renon is a new century dynamic company established in the year 2007 in Ahmedabad. Within a short span of 11 years INDIGO Paints has been able to garner a substantial presence in nearly 14 states across India, with more than 6000 dealers enabled by a distinctive product portfolio, a sales force philosophy that makes each one of them real stakeholders in the business and a management approach that is lean, focused and responsive.

key: Yashwanth Hemaraj + Benhamou Global Ventures (2 About + JD)
text: I am a Venture Capital Investor at Benhamou Global Ventures investing in enterprise startups exclusively. At BGV, we are helping entrepreneurs leading early stage companies build great companies within the enterprise software space. We invest in Series A companies that have reached what we refer to as a "minimum sellable product" stage. In 2018, I founded an India focused cross border accelerator called Arka Venture Labs to provide a platform for Indian B2B product focused start-ups to scale to the global markets. Our goal in both of these is to roll up our sleeves and work with the entrepreneurs we fund, much like an extension of the team. We continue to work with the companies across their growth cycle. Previously, I worked as a Product Manager at SpiderCloud, a startup in the wireless telecommunication space that I joined as an early engineer. We raised more than $100MM between 2008-2012 and was ranked #5 in the “top venture backed companies” by Wall Street Journal. I have 4 patents in this area that form an integral part of the SpiderCloud IP portfolio. I obtained my MBA at the Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University, IL with focus on Finance, Entrepreneurship and Business Strategy, MS at the University of Maryland in Electrical Engineering and BE at National Institute of Technology in Electronics and Communication. I am a fellow of the Startup leadership program in Silicon Valley (2013.) I was on the board of United Way of Silicon Valley, where I led the emerging leaders affiliate group as the chair of the steering committee. I was the President of the undergraduate alumni association, NITKAN (501c3). No frills, no ego, WYSIWYG (What you see is what you get) type of personality.Venture Capital Investor in Early-Stage Enterprise Software Startups anchored in Silicon Valley. Built our Enterprise 4.0 investment thesis and manage our deal evaluation frameworks across different segments such as Cyber Security, Internet of Things, Robotics, AI, Blockchain, and Business Intelligence applications, typically those that drive the digital transformation of the enterprises. Help with due diligence, fund management and deal syndication. Hold frequent office hours with entrepreneurs to provide feedback on business models, go to market strategy and fund raising. Arka Venture Labs is a first of its kind platform for Indian B2B startups to establish and scale in the US. “Arka” in Sanskrit means a sun-beam - a guiding light we will provide to startups to scale up into the global markets. We have three leading VCs - Blume Ventures, Benhamou Global Ventures, Emergent Ventures- as anchors providing not just seed and pre-seed capital but also mentorship, infrastructure and access to the Silicon Valley ecosystem critical for scaling up startups in the US.“We help Indian enterprise startups overcome the ‘trust gap’ that exists between these India based start-ups and customers, investors and acquirers. We plan to make Arka Venture Labs an open platform to bring all the help we need in order to bridge this trust gap” says Yashwanth Hemaraj, investor at BGV and one of the founding partners at Arka Venture Labs. - Defined staffing models, coordinated workflow for 50+ staff and led change management during restructuring. - Spearheaded vendor due diligence, and led a post market offshoring initiative. - Defined and executed a 2 year offshore transition plan, including designing SLAs. Partnered with the vendor and BSC senior leadership to manage risks - Led a CAPA to drive conformance to CFR 803 on time reporting regulations. Awarded Platinum CAPA Cup. - Managed a team of 20+ Supporting 4 systems - led IT org design strategy - managed executive level visible projects including Daily Sales Reporting( to CEO). - Defined a sourcing strategy to realize $500k savings - Managed vendor relationships. Negotiated $450k in savings for a $850k contract. - Created and executed vision and roadmap for Business Intelligence Competency Center - Mobilized resources/funds across five functions and championed a $ 2.4 m business intelligence solution. - Lead a team of 25 engineers to drive formal software verification for Pacemaker/Defib in collaboration with systems engineering. - Defined strategy and executed formal software validation for medical device software. Reduced cycle time from 4 weeks to 5 days . -Led a cross-functional regression team of 6 engineers for multiple new product /sustaining projects. -Defined and implemented training program for PRM Software Verification team. - Championed Diversity initiatives by being voice of BSC for 2 years at the Society Of Women Engineers.
